Title: Verify presence of Referrals page elements in Miscellaneous component
Desc: Validates that key interactive elements for the Referrals tab rendered by Miscellaneous.jsx and ReferralTable component are present and visible. Also validates form toggle behavior when clicking the add referral button.
Detailed Steps:
1. Verify [data-testid='miscellaneous-container'] is visible
2. Verify [data-testid='tabs-container'] is visible
3. Verify [data-testid='referrals-tab'] is visible
4. Verify [data-testid='referral-table-container'] is visible
5. Verify [data-testid='referral-table'] is visible
6. Verify [data-testid='add-referral-button'] is visible
7. Close any open popovers
8. Verify [data-testid='add-referral-button'] is visible and enabled if form is closed
9. Verify form is initially hidden
10. Click [data-testid='add-referral-button'] to open form
11. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-input'] is visible
12. Verify [data-testid='referral-type-select'] is visible
13. Verify [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] is visible
14. Verify [data-testid='save-referral-button'] is visible and disabled
15. Verify [data-testid='add-referral-button'] is hidden when form is open
16. Assert all referral-related elements are visible and form toggle works correctly
Precondition: User authenticated; Navigated to route that renders Miscellaneous.jsx; Referrals tab is active
Expected Result: All referral-related elements (miscellaneous-container, tabs-container, referrals-tab, referral-table-container, referral-table, add-referral-button) are visible; Form opens when clicking add-referral-button; All form fields become visible; Add referral button is hidden when form is open

Title: Check Search button functionality
Desc: Validates search button disabled state initially, with invalid length mobile number, and with valid 10-digit number. Form is already open from previous test.
Detailed Steps:
1. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-button'] is disabled initially
2. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-input'] is visible
3. Fill [data-testid='mobile-search-input'] with '123' (invalid length)
4. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-button'] remains disabled
5. Fill [data-testid='mobile-search-input'] with '1234567890' (valid 10 digits)
6. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-button'] becomes enabled
7. Assert button state changes correctly based on input validation
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active; Add referral form is open
Expected Result: Search button is disabled initially; Remains disabled with invalid input (3 digits); Becomes enabled with valid 10-digit mobile number

Title: Search by mobile number and select result to populate form
Desc: Searches by mobile number (9999999999), selects result from popover, and verifies form fields populate (mobile, name, person type).
Detailed Steps:
1. Ensure add referral form is open (open if not already open)
2. Search by mobile number '9999999999'
3. Click [data-testid='mobile-search-button']
4. Wait for search results popover to appear (timeout: 5000ms)
5. Select result from popover (filtering by '.* - 9999999999')
6. Verify [data-testid='mobile-search-input'] is populated with '9999999999'
7. Verify referrer name is populated in the form row (third column)
8. Verify person type is populated in the form row (second column)
9. Assert all form fields are populated correctly from the selected search result
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active
Expected Result: Search results popover appears; Clicking result populates form fields (mobile, name, person type); All fields display correct data

Title: Select referral type, save referral, and verify in table
Desc: Selects referral type, saves referral, verifies success toast, and verifies new row appears in table with all columns populated.
Detailed Steps:
1. Ensure form is populated with mobile '9999999999' (populate if not)
2. Select referral type from [data-testid='referral-type-select'] (first option)
3. Get initial table row count
4. Click [data-testid='save-referral-button']
5. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
6. Verify success toast is visible using locator('.Toastify__toast--success')
7. Verify toast message contains 'successfully'
8. Verify new referral row appears in [data-testid='referral-table'] containing '9999999999'
9. Verify table row count increased
10. Verify all columns are populated: mobile in first column, person type in second column, name in third column, referral type in fourth column
11. Assert referral data is correctly saved and displayed in table
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active; Form is populated with referrer data
Expected Result: Success toast appears with 'successfully' message; New referral row appears in table; Table row count increases; All columns populated correctly (mobile, person type, name, referral type)

Title: Complete flow with mobile number 8948235101
Desc: Searches by mobile number (8948235101), selects result from popover, verifies form fields populate, selects referral type, saves referral, verifies success toast, and verifies new row appears in table with all columns populated.
Detailed Steps:
1. Open add referral form if not already open
2. Search by mobile number '8948235101'
3. Click [data-testid='mobile-search-button']
4. Wait for search results popover to appear
5. Select result from popover (filtering by '.* - 8948235101')
6. Verify form fields populate (mobile, name, person type)
7. Select referral type from [data-testid='referral-type-select'] (first option)
8. Get initial table row count
9. Click [data-testid='save-referral-button']
10. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
11. Verify success toast is visible with message containing 'successfully'
12. Verify new referral row appears in table containing '8948235101'
13. Verify table row count increased
14. Verify all columns are populated correctly
15. Verify saved mobile contains '8948235101'
16. Verify saved name matches the selected referrer name
17. Assert complete referral flow works correctly
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active
Expected Result: Search, select, populate, and save flow completes successfully; New referral appears in table with all columns populated; Saved data matches searched referrer data

Title: Open Add New Referrer popover and verify fields
Desc: Validates that clicking the add-referrer-button opens a popover with all required fields (Type, Name, Mobile) and the Create button. Tests popover functionality and field visibility.
Detailed Steps:
1. Verify [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] is visible and enabled
2. Wait a moment to ensure any previous popover state is cleared
3. Click [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] to open popover
4. Wait for [data-testid='add-referrer-popover-content'] to be visible (timeout: 5000ms)
5. Verify [data-testid='referrer-type-select'] is visible (with scroll into view if needed)
6. Verify [data-testid='referrer-name-input'] is visible
7. Verify [data-testid='referrer-mobile-input'] is visible
8. Verify [data-testid='create-referrer-button'] is visible and disabled
9. Close popover to leave clean state
10. Assert all popover fields are present
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active; Add referral form is open
Expected Result: Popover opens with all required fields visible (referrer-type-select, referrer-name-input, referrer-mobile-input, create-referrer-button); Create button is disabled initially

Title: Validate Create Referrer button enablement after filling all fields
Desc: Ensures the Create Referrer button becomes enabled only when all required fields (Type, Name, and 10-digit Mobile) are filled with valid values. Tests form validation logic.
Detailed Steps:
1. Close any open popovers
2. Ensure add referral row is open
3. Click [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] to open popover
4. Wait for [data-testid='add-referrer-popover-content'] to be visible (timeout: 5000ms)
5. Get reference to [data-testid='create-referrer-button'] and verify it's visible
6. Click [data-testid='referrer-type-select'] and select first available option
7. Fill [data-testid='referrer-name-input'] with 'John Doe'
8. Fill [data-testid='referrer-mobile-input'] with '9876543210'
9. Verify [data-testid='create-referrer-button'] becomes enabled
10. Close popover to leave clean state
11. Assert button state changes based on field validation
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active; Add referral row is open
Expected Result: After filling all fields (type, name, 10-digit mobile), Create button becomes enabled

Title: Create new referrer with valid data
Desc: Validates the complete flow of creating a new referrer. After successful creation, the referrer data should populate the referral form fields and the popover should close.
Detailed Steps:
1. Close any open popovers
2. Ensure add referral row is open
3. Click [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] to open popover
4. Wait for [data-testid='add-referrer-popover-content'] to be visible (timeout: 5000ms)
5. Select a valid type from [data-testid='referrer-type-select'] (first option)
6. Fill [data-testid='referrer-name-input'] with a unique name using timestamp
7. Fill [data-testid='referrer-mobile-input'] with a unique 10-digit mobile number using timestamp
8. Verify [data-testid='create-referrer-button'] is enabled
9. Click [data-testid='create-referrer-button']
10. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
11. Verify success toast is visible using locator('.Toastify__toast--success') or check for error toast
12. Verify popover is closed
13. Assert referrer creation was successful
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active; Add referral row is open
Expected Result: Success toast appears or error is handled appropriately; Popover closes after referrer creation

Title: Validate Save Referral button disabled state until all fields valid
Desc: Ensures the Save Referral button remains disabled until all required fields (mobile, referrer type, referral type, and referrer name) are filled with valid values. Tests referral form validation by creating a new referrer.
Detailed Steps:
1. Close any open popovers
2. Ensure add referral form is open
3. Clear any existing data in the form
4. Verify [data-testid='save-referral-button'] is initially disabled
5. Click [data-testid='add-referrer-button'] to open popover
6. Wait for [data-testid='add-referrer-popover-content'] to be visible (timeout: 5000ms)
7. Fill referrer type by clicking [data-testid='referrer-type-select'] and selecting first option
8. Fill [data-testid='referrer-name-input'] with 'Test Referrer'
9. Fill [data-testid='referrer-mobile-input'] with a unique 10-digit mobile number using timestamp
10. Click [data-testid='create-referrer-button']
11. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
12. Verify success toast is visible or error is handled
13. Verify popover is closed
14. Wait for form state to update (timeout: 500ms)
15. Verify [data-testid='save-referral-button'] is enabled after creating referrer (select referral type if needed)
16. Click [data-testid='save-referral-button']
17. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
18. Verify success toast is visible with message containing 'successfully'
19. Verify [data-testid='referral-table'] is visible
20. Locate the referral row containing the created referrer mobile number
21. Verify all columns are populated: mobile in first column, person type in second column, name in third column, referral type in fourth column
22. Verify saved mobile number matches the created referrer mobile
23. Verify saved name matches 'Test Referrer'
24. Assert referral data is correctly saved and displayed in table
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active
Expected Result: Save button is disabled initially; After creating referrer and selecting referral type, Save button becomes enabled; After saving, success toast appears; Referral appears in table with all columns populated correctly; Saved data matches created referrer data

Title: Verify referral data displayed in table columns
Desc: Validates that all referral data is correctly displayed in the respective table columns (Mobile, Person type, Name, Referral Type). Tests data rendering and column alignment.
Detailed Steps:
1. Verify [data-testid='referral-table'] is visible
2. Locate the first referral row in the table
3. Get row count
4. If row count > 0:
5. Verify the row contains mobile number in first column
6. Verify the row contains person type (referrer type) in second column
7. Verify the row contains referrer name in third column
8. Verify the row contains referral type in fourth column
9. Verify [data-testid='delete-referral-button'] is present in the row
10. Log all column values for verification
11. Assert all columns display correct data
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active
Expected Result: All table columns display correct data (mobile in first column, person type in second column, name in third column, referral type in fourth column); Delete button is present in each row

Title: Delete referral and verify removal from table
Desc: Validates the deletion flow for a referral. After successful deletion, the referral should be removed from the table and a success toast should be displayed.
Detailed Steps:
1. Verify [data-testid='referral-table'] is visible
2. Locate the first referral row with delete button
3. Get row count before deletion
4. If row count > 0 and delete button is visible:
5. Click [data-testid='delete-referral-button']
6. Wait for API call to complete (timeout: 2000ms)
7. Verify success toast is visible using locator('.Toastify__toast--success')
8. Get row count after deletion
9. Verify row count decreased after deletion
10. Log before/after row counts
11. Assert deletion was successful and table updated correctly
Precondition: User is on Miscellaneous page with Referrals tab active
Expected Result: Success toast appears; Deleted referral row is removed from table; Table row count decreases; Deletion flow completes successfully
